is a city and a municipality in district of the Indian state of Kerala. It is an ancient maritime trading centre and is almost equidistant from

100 km from Trivandrum International Airport, on National Highway 47.
130 km from Cochin International Airport, Nedumbassery, Alwaye, on National Highway 47.
Kayamkulam Railway Junction is 1.5 km from the town. Trains from the North from Ernakulam via Kottayam, and from Ernakulam via Alappuzha pass through Kayamkulam Junction and then proceed to Kollam, Thiruvananthapuram and further to Nagercoil and Kanyakumari.
Taxis and Auto Rickshaws and private buses available to move around.

Oachira Vrishchikam festival is celebrated every year at the Oachira Temple.
Chettikulangara Kumbha Bharani, the bharani festival celebrated in the month of Kumbham is an important event for the people of this locality and neighbouring places.
The Krishnapuram Palace is a tourist attraction, just 400 m from NH-47 located between Kayamkulam town and Oachira. The palace is maintained by the Archeological Department and contains exhibits that belonged to the Palace and its former occupant, the Travancore Maharaja Marthanda Varma
Watch the making of Coir and other coconut products at local farms.
Toddy form the numerous toddy shops at village sides.
